title: Senior Accountant, Finance – Owned Distribution
content:
Job Summary
This position will support the development of the financial plan and financial reporting for the Owned Distribution segment of the Retail Business Unit at F&G.  This role will also support the Finance Department’s execution of integration procedures for acquisitions of partner distribution entities (PDE) identified.
This position reports directly to the Director, Finance – Owned Distribution and will work closely with PDE Finance Department personnel. This position will collaborate with team members within F&G finance, IT and other shared services departments to build and implement the Owned Distribution financial plan and ensure timely and accurate financial reporting.  
Duties and Responsibilities
Financial Reporting

Prepare financial information, including financial statements and management reports, for Owned Distribution segment
Perform the necessary procedures to ensure timely and accurate reporting of financial results for the Owned Distribution segment
Perform internal controls designed to mitigate identified risks within the financial reporting process
Assist with requests of both internal and external auditors
Research and analyze GAAP accounting guidance for financial reporting, purchase accounting and integration activities
Assist with ad hoc requests and other duties related to financial reporting and analysis, as assigned

Integration

Assist the PDE to transition from cash to GAAP accounting, as applicable
Identify data and process requirements to ensure accurate and complete financial reporting for PDE and Owned Distribution segment
Work with F&G FP&A, Treasury, Financial Reporting (Statutory and GAAP), and Tax to ensure all F&G financial reporting needs are met for all PDE
Assist the F&G Accounting and IT departments along with PDE to ensure proper financial reporting data flow
Identify opportunities for process improvements (e.g., use of technology to drive automation) and efficiencies for flexible, scalable and accurate processes

Financial Planning

In partnership with leadership, help to execute efficient, comprehensive process for to produce financial projections and budget amounts for each PDE
Serve as liaison between the PDE and F&G for inputs, outputs, and execution of the end-to-end financial projections and budget processes
Assist leadership and the PDE for the production and distribution of aggregated GAAP projections and analysis across all PDE, considering material nonpublic information (MNPI) requirements 

Experience and Education Requirements

Bachelor's degree or commensurate experience required
3+ years’ operations experience in life insurance and annuity company and/or life insurance and annuity distribution company required
Experience in independent life insurance and annuity distribution (IMO) financial reporting (Statutory and GAAP) preferred
Knowledge of life insurance and annuity products preferred
Experience with Excel and PowerPoint required

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Excellent communication and presentation skills
Highly motivated, self-starter & team player with a high energy level and willingness to take on responsibility
Exceptional interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate across all levels and departments within the organization
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and lead multiple, concurrent projects of varying sizes and complexities under tight deadlines
Ability to translate large amounts of data for analysis and transform this into actionable items
Builds trust and camaraderie between team members
Unconditional integrity and commitment to exemplify F&G Cultural values of Authenticity, Collaboration, Empowerment and Dynamic

Other Requirements

Perform other functions, duties and projects as assigned
Regular and punctual attendance
Limited travel required (<5%)

Additional Information 
Work Environments
F&G believes in an employee-centric flexible environment, which is why we offer the ability for in-office, hybrid and remote work arrangements. During the hiring process, you'll work with your leader to decide what works best for your role.
Join our employee-centric hybrid work environment: F&G Careers
About F&G
Since 1959, Fidelity & Guaranty Life Insurance Company (F&G) has offered annuity and life insurance products to those who are seeking security in retirement and protection during life’s unexpected events.
As a national Top Workplace1, an Iowa Top Workplace2 and a proud equal opportunity employer, F&G team members are empowered, collaborative, dynamic and authentic. We believe that by embracing these values, we will continue to build and strengthen the company while continuing to be a great place to work.
